content: Secondary school in Singapore **Naval Base Secondary School** (NBSS) is a [co-educational](/wiki/Mixed-sex_education) [government](/wiki/State_school) secondary school in [Yishun](/wiki/Yishun), Singapore. Founded in 1957, NBSS initially began as a school for children of employees of the [British Navy](/wiki/Royal_Navy). Since 2003, NBSS has been organizing overseas trips for their students to decrease [delinquency](/wiki/School_discipline) along with getting students more interested in [the arts](/wiki/The_arts). ## History ### Naval Base School (1957–1968) Naval Base Secondary School was founded in 1957 as **Naval Base School (NBS)**. Naval Base School had initially started with two [Secondary](/wiki/Secondary_education_in_Singapore) classes housed at [Yio Chu Kang Primary School](/wiki/List_of_primary_schools_in_Singapore). In 1958, They moved to Bah Tan Road after the [British Navy](/wiki/Royal_Navy) had set aside some land in the British Naval Base for children of the Naval Base employees. Students from [Yio Chu Kang Primary School](/wiki/List_of_primary_schools_in_Singapore) and [Admiralty Asian School](/wiki/List_of_primary_schools_in_Singapore) were also moved to the new Naval Base School. In 1965, [Rudy Mosbergen](/wiki/Rudy_Mosbergen), the fourth principal of Naval Base School, composed the lyrics and music of Naval Base School's [school song](/wiki/List_of_school_songs). In 1968, the school was renamed to **Naval Base Secondary School** when the primary had moved to Canberra School. ### Naval Base Secondary School (1969–1999) In 1980, NBSS moved to [Yishun](/wiki/Yishun) to meet the needs of the growing residential population. In 1986, NBSS participated in the [Singapore Youth Festival](/wiki/Singapore_Youth_Festival). In 1990, then-[Minister of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)), [Tony Tan](/wiki/Tony_Tan), officiates the opening of NBSS's new building in Yishun. In 1999, NBSS established links with the [Republic of Singapore's Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy). ### Progress as Naval Base Secondary School (2000–present) In 2000, NBSS added a new block to its building which was opened by Mr Yahya Aljaru. In 2003, NBSS began organizing overseas study trips to encourage students and motivate their interest in [the arts](/wiki/The_arts). In 2004, the NBSS Art Department set up an art exhibition at the [Asian Civilisations Museum](/wiki/Asian_Civilisations_Museum). In 2008, NBSS underwent [PRIME](/wiki/Programme_for_Rebuilding_and_Improving_Existing_Schools) and was temporarily housed at [Sembawang](/wiki/Sembawang) from 2008 to 2009. NBSS returned to its Yishun campus the following year and was officially opened by [Mr Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat). In 2010, NBSS was recognized as a niche school in [Visual Arts](/wiki/Visual_art_of_Singapore) and the Art Department began work on a community wall, inspired by [Antoni Gaudi](/wiki/Antoni_Gaud%C3%AD), finished in 2014. ## Identity and culture ### School crest The lion represents [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and taking pride in their national identity. The open book represents the importance of education and knowledge. The four yellow lines represent the [four ethnic groups in Singapore](/wiki/Demographics_of_Singapore), [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_Singaporeans), [Malay](/wiki/Malay_Singaporeans), [Indian](/wiki/Indian_Singaporeans), [Others](/wiki/Eurasian_Singaporeans), and working together in harmony. The blue background represents their commitment to integrating new citizens into [Singapore's socio-cultural](/wiki/Culture_of_Singapore) diversity. The three rings are inspired by the [Olympics](/wiki/Olympic_Games). ## Notable alumni - [Quah Kim Song](/wiki/Quah_Kim_Song), Singaporean footballer - [Subhas Anandan](/wiki/Subhas_Anandan), Singaporean criminal lawyer - [Carl Tong](/wiki/Carl_Tong), Hong Kong businessman - [Mohd Anwar Mohd Nor](/wiki/Mohd_Anwar_Mohd_Nor), Malaysian admiral - [Secondary schools in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_secondary_schools_in_Singapore) - *Recollections: 50 years of Naval Base Secondary School*.
